Interface Robot

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractRobot, CycloBot, HumanoidRobot, WheeledRobot
public interface Robot
Interface defining the main methods for a generic Robot. See the AbstractRobot class for an implementation of some of the main methods.
Author:
marcoortolani

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    attack(Robot r)
    If any of the energy levels is zero, the robot cannot attack.
    double
    fendOff(double strikeCoefficient)
    This method implements the response to an attack.
    double
    getActuatorsEnergy()
    Returns the energy level of the actuator parts of this robot, computed as the sum of the energy levels of all its parts.
    double
    getAttackCoeff()
    Returns the attack coefficient of the robot, computed as the sum of the attack coefficients of the actuator parts.
    double
    getDefenceceCoeff()
    Returns the defence coefficient of the robot, computed as the sum of the defence coefficients of the sensor parts.
    double
    getFrameEnergy()
    Returns the energy level of the frame of this robot
    double
    getMotorEnergy()
    Returns the energy level of the motor parts of this robot
    int
    getNumParts()
    Returns the number of parts of this robot
    double
    getSensorsEnergy()
    Returns the energy level of the sensor parts of this robot, computed as the sum of the energy levels of all its parts.
    void
    refillActuatorsEnergy(RepairBay bay)
    This methods "repairs" the actuator parts by refilling their energy levels.
    void

    This methods "repairs" the frame by refilling its energy levels.

    This methods "repairs" the motor parts by refilling their energy levels.
    void

  • Method Details

    • getNumParts

      int getNumParts()
      Returns the number of parts of this robot
      Returns:
      the number of parts of this robot

    • getMotorEnergy

      double getMotorEnergy()
      Returns the energy level of the motor parts of this robot
      Returns:
      the energy level of the motor parts

    • getFrameEnergy

      double getFrameEnergy()
      Returns the energy level of the frame of this robot
      Returns:
      the energy level of the frame

    • getSensorsEnergy

      double getSensorsEnergy()
      Returns the energy level of the sensor parts of this robot, computed as the sum of the energy levels of all its parts.
      Returns:
      the energy level of the sensor parts

    • getActuatorsEnergy

      double getActuatorsEnergy()
      Returns the energy level of the actuator parts of this robot, computed as the sum of the energy levels of all its parts.
      Returns:
      the energy level of the actuator parts

    • refillFrameEnergy

      void refillFrameEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the frame by refilling its energy levels. If the frame energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • refillMotorEnergy

      void refillMotorEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the motor parts by refilling their energy levels. If the motor energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • refillSensorsEnergy

      void refillSensorsEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the sensor parts by refilling their energy levels. If the sensor energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • refillActuatorsEnergy

      void refillActuatorsEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the actuator parts by refilling their energy levels. If the actuator energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • getDefenceceCoeff

      double getDefenceceCoeff()
      Returns the defence coefficient of the robot, computed as the sum of the defence coefficients of the sensor parts.
      Returns:
      the defence coefficient of the robot

    • getAttackCoeff

      double getAttackCoeff()
      Returns the attack coefficient of the robot, computed as the sum of the attack coefficients of the actuator parts.
      Returns:
      the attack coefficient of the robot

    • attack

      void attack(Robot r)
      If any of the energy levels is zero, the robot cannot attack. The attack is implemented in practice by calling the fendOff() method of the attacked robot (which decreases its energy levels as appropriate)
      Parameters:
      r - the reference to the Robot object to be attacked

    • fendOff

      double fendOff(double strikeCoefficient)
      This method implements the response to an attack. It basically causes a delay (simulating the time needed for the attack) and decreases the energy level of this robot's parts as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      strikeCoefficient - the strength of the strike (i.e. the attack coefficient of the attacker)
      Returns:
      the energy level of the robot after the attack
